item.title: Report X-2024090841

Report X-2024090841

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered damaged during sort operations. It was making a hissing noise with powder escaping from the box. Inner contents: Fire Extinguisher. The pin was detatched or dislodged causing the the extinguisher to expel its contents. The package was placed in a salvage drum and held penidng disposition from the customer.

item.title: Report E-2024090293
item.description:
Report E-2024090293

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NRO experienced an approximate ten (10) gallons release of UN1760 Hydroco BT-78 from one (1) 20-gallon poly drum impacting the trailer floor and asphalt underneath the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 45'X1' area of the trailer floor and a 10'x2' area of the asphalt underneath the trailer. An estimated ten (10) gallons of material was released due to a pallet nail puncture. Contractors overpacked the two drums, neutralized the area, deployed absorbents, and cleaned up the released material. The damaged drum, impacted drum, and recovered material were placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
